content: opa s sokken if you enjoyed knitting my oma s sokken pattern you ll love this simple variation which i ve called opa s sokken dutch for opa s socks the simple ribbed pattern is fun and easy with a bit of a twist this pattern is perfect for beginner sock knitters as well as seasoned sock knitters looking for something a little different from a plain vanilla sock the ribbed pattern ensures a fantastic fit and these socks look great whether you knit shorties or longer length socks with self-striping variegated or tonal yarn also a great scrap buster i hope you ll join me in casting on a pair size approx foot circumference yarn adult small medium large turtlepurl sock yarn in patience 7½ inches or 19 cm 8½ inches or 22 cm 9½ inches or 80% superwash merino 20% nylon 24 cm 379 m 420 yd 115 g needles notions 2 25 mm or us 1 double pointed needles tapestry needle stitch marker s set of 5 gauge or your preferred needles for knitting in the round or on 32 stitches = approx 10 cm unblocked 2 circular needles ___________________________________________________________________________ the pattern is written to be knit with dpns but can be adapted for knitting in the round or with 2 circular needles magic loop if that s your preferred method if you re knitting socks for the first time you may find knitting on circular needles the easiest especially if you have some experience knitting in the round there are a lot of excellent tutorials on youtube for reference no matter which method you use it may be helpful to use a stitch marker or progress keeper to mark the beginning of your round you can also place stitch markers after every 14 16 18 stitches to mimic the 4 needles referenced in this pattern note there is no further mention of stitch markers in this pattern so if you use them just slip them from needle to needle as you go along ready to cast on let s go cast on 56 64 72 stitches using the long tail cast on method distribute evenly on 4 needles you should have 14 16 18 stitches on each needle join in the round carefully making sure you don t twist any stitches cuff k2 p2 for 8 rounds or longer if you like a longer cuff there s no right or wrong here ribbed leg pattern leg of the sock all sizes round 1-3 *k3 p1* repeat across all 28 32 36 stitches on n1 and n2 k the remainingl 28 32 36 stitches on n3 and n4 round 4 k across all 56 64 72 stitches repeat rounds 1-4 until you reach your desired leg length you can knit knee socks ankle socks or somewhere in between now you re ready to start on the heel portion of the sock there are many
